name: Visualization of Forensic Demonstrative Evidence
description: This course examines the visual representation of forensic demonstrative evidence in Canadian courtrooms. A case-based approach simulates professional practice. Forensic anthropology, biology and visual communication theory are explored in new media for presentation. Visual problem solving skills are developed through collaboration. In class, presentations and practica are combined with critical analysis of visualizations. [12L, 24P]
prerequisites: Completion of 10.0 credits, including one of FSC239Y5/ BIO210H5/ 210Y5/ ANT205H5/ ANT306H5
